Amproid is an independently developed audio client for the Ampache (https://ampache.org) media server. It is NOT a streaming service. To use Amproid, it must be connected to your Ampache instance. 


 Connecting to your Ampache server 

 When you first start Amproid, the Add Account dialog is displayed automatically. Otherwise, tap Accounts in the menu, then tap Add. Enter the server's URL, your user name, and your password, followed by OK. Amproid attempts to connect to the server immediately. Passwords are stored securely in Android’s Account manager. 


 Exploring and playing content 

 Amproid provides four tabs to help you explore the contents on your Ampache server: 

 For You offers recommendations based on your favorites and your listening history. You can tap the refresh button to get a new set of recommendations. 

 Search Results displays the results of your last search. You can search either by tapping the magnifying glass icon, or using Google Assistant. In the latter case, Amproid automatically starts playing a close match when the search completes. 

 Playlists shows all playlists and smart list created on your server. When you first click this tab, Amproid downloads and caches this list. Tap the refresh button to have the list downloaded again, for example if you create a new playlist or smart list on your server. 

 New shows a list of recently added albums. 


 Now Playing 

 This tab displays details of the currently playing track, such as the album art, title, artist, and album. When you’re playing an entire album or playlist, you can also tap the title to display the list of tracks, where you can tap a track to play it straight away.
